quests.title: The Call
quests.overview: Conscription day in the Dims. Xal publicly defines his stance toward the Empire.
quests.preconditions: Start of game; tutorial movement complete; player has basic interact/stealth.
raw: Overview: Conscription day in the Dims. Xal publicly defines his stance toward the Empire.
Preconditions: Start of game; tutorial movement complete; player has basic interact/stealth.
Branches
• Obey the Call
Objectives:
– Report to the Hasran officer before curfew.
– Maintain order in the line without escalation.
– Submit to branding inspection; keep calm during the heat spike.
– Escort conscripts to barracks yard with minimal disruption.
Encounters: Crowd-control corridor with shove/taunt NPCs (tutorial: shove break, dodge shove).; Inspection QTE (steady-hand; timing window widens on Story difficulty).
Variable Checks / Flags: Morality −1; Reputation.Hasran +1; Reputation.Outcasts −1.; Carryover: C/O:Obedient.
Fail-forward: If QTE fails or a scuffle starts, guards subdue the disturbance; you’re disciplined but proceed to Barracks with a 10‑min ‘Fatigue’ debuff (stamina regen −10%).
• Resist publicly
Objectives:
– Climb to the scaffold and deliver a defiant address.
– Evade Hasran patrol sweep using soft stealth and rooftops.
– Reach the barracks yard without capture.
Encounters: Short chase across two patrol choke points; optional alley stealth tutorial (crouch, line-of-sight cones).; Crowd reaction mini-system (boos/cheers) affected by timing beats.
Variable Checks / Flags: Morality +1; Reputation.Hasran −1; Reputation.Outcasts +1; SaghirLoyalty +1 (latent sympathy).; Carryover: C/O:Defiant.
Fail-forward: If captured, you’re dragged to Barracks anyway; Outcasts reputation still increases via rumor spread.
Rejoin/Convergence: Converges at Barracks intro → Drills.
Rewards/Flags: XP: small; Materials: ration set. Flags seeded: Obedient or Defiant tone.
Systems/Notes: Crowd VO and tutorial signage swap based on this branch.

quests.title: Saghir’s Rescue
quests.overview: A rat‑blood mage is marked for execution. Do you intervene or obey?
quests.preconditions: After the ‘Baptism by Fire’ skirmish; player has lock-on/dodge basics.
raw: Overview: A rat‑blood mage is marked for execution. Do you intervene or obey?
Preconditions: After the ‘Baptism by Fire’ skirmish; player has lock-on/dodge basics.
Branches
• Rescue Saghir
Objectives:
– Create a distraction or pickpocket keys (player choice).
– Break the execution chain with a Catalyst spark (timed input).
– Escape the square with Saghir through side alleys to a safe shack.
Encounters: Mini-boss: Hasran Lieutenant (shield timing/parry tutorial).; Escape path with two skill-based shortcuts (parkour ladders / narrow beams).

Variable Checks / Flags: Morality +1; SaghirLoyalty +20; Reputation.Hasran −1; Reputation.Outcasts +1.; Unlock: Saghir tertiary kit immediately (Glyph Snap, Ward Pocket baseline).; Carryover: C/O:SaghirEarlyJoin.
Fail-forward: If downed by the Lieutenant, a bystander ‘trip’ triggers a fumble cutaway—escape continues; SaghirLoyalty +10 instead of +20.
• Obey the order
Objectives:
– Stand down during the execution protocol.
– Assist with crowd control to prevent a riot (dialogue timing checks).
Encounters: Crowd pacification mini-game (callouts, posture, restraint vs force).
Variable Checks / Flags: Morality −1; SaghirLoyalty −5; Reputation.Hasran +1.; Saghir joins later at the Academy with reduced early kit access.; Carryover: C/O:SaghirDelayedJoin.
Fail-forward: If a riot sparks, guards punish the crowd; you still reach Tribunal; Hasran +2 then −1 (confused orders).
Rejoin/Convergence: Both converge at Tribunal → Arena.
Rewards/Flags: XP: medium; Unlock: Saghir kit (timing varies).
Systems/Notes: Banter density increases if Saghir joins early.

quests.title: Temple Defense — Order Choice
quests.overview: Pick which demigod-linked assault to counter first: Dalanthar (Aegis) or Celeste (Pyre).
raw: Overview: Pick which demigod-linked assault to counter first: Dalanthar (Aegis) or Celeste (Pyre).
Preconditions: After Q13_TempleRecon; Act III.
Branches
• Dalanthar first (Aegis)
Objectives:
– Reach outer courtyards; deploy temporary wards at three choke points.
– Disable four sigil pylons while under shield pressure.
– Repel Aegis’ spear-guard phalanx; protect ward carriers.
Encounters: Shield-heavy elites; stagger windows gated by precise parries.; Ward Pocket tutorials; rotating hazard lines from pylon feedback.
Variable Checks / Flags: Morality +1; Carryover: C/O:Temple_First_Dalanthar.
Fail-forward: If two pylons overcharge, fallback doors open; Celeste later spawns an additional Pyre elite pack.
• Celeste first (Pyre)
Objectives:
– Escort relic bearers between cloisters.
– Purge three planar anchors while managing fire lanes.
– Hold an inner sanctum as Pyre’s vanguard breaches.
Encounters: Tight corridors with flame sweeps; emphasizes i-frames and short blink.; Relic carrier AI that pauses at safe alcoves; player clears lanes.
Variable Checks / Flags: CatalystResonance +1; Carryover: C/O:Temple_First_Celeste.
Fail-forward: If an anchor detonates, evac still succeeds; Dalanthar later gains an extra elite spear-guard during its finale.
Rejoin/Convergence: Completion of both is required before Q16 Airship Heist; order modifies enemy mixes in the second temple and Siege.
Rewards/Flags: XP: medium per temple; Materials: ward shards; vendor stock shifts based on collateral.
Systems/Notes: Ambient sermons and hub gossip change based on first-hit temple.

quests.title: Spear of Jhordil — Airship Heist
quests.overview: Seize the last Elentian battleship to support the Siege with air routes and artillery.
quests.preconditions: After both temple defenses complete; Act V opener.
raw: Overview: Seize the last Elentian battleship to support the Siege with air routes and artillery.
Preconditions: After both temple defenses complete; Act V opener.
Branches
• Stealth takeover
Objectives:
– Infiltrate via mooring chains; disable alarm bells (timed prompts).
– Silent takedown crew squads; avoid spotlight arcs.
– Seize the bridge and lock command with a cipher.
Encounters: Vertical stealth: mast crossbeams, rope slides, patrol cones.; Bridge duo with awareness link (break line-of-sight to split).
Variable Checks / Flags: Morality +1; Carryover: C/O:Spear_Stealth.
Fail-forward: If discovered, escalates to deck skirmish before the bridge; minor loot loss; branch outcome remains ‘Stealth’.
• Direct assault
Objectives:
– Grapple onto the deck; defeat two squad leads and the bosun.
– Overload the engine room to force surrender; push to bridge.
– Clear hangar bay to unlock evac corridor bonus later.
Encounters: Wave combat with knockback hazards; explosives near powder kegs.; Mini-boss pair with alternating windows; bosun rally shout buff.
Variable Checks / Flags: CatalystResonance +2; Carryover: C/O:Spear_Assault.
Fail-forward: If engine overload hits red, emergency vent opens; you escape to the bridge with a CR +1 extra surge (exposure).
Rejoin/Convergence: Both converge at Bridge Control → Siege setup.
Rewards/Flags: XP: large; Unlocks: airship traversal and Siege objective variants (evac corridors for Stealth, extra ballistae for Assault).
Systems/Notes: Future hub banners show ‘bloodless coup’ vs ‘stormed decks’ messaging.

quests.title: Spy in the Academy — Macha
quests.overview: Expose Macha as a Fomori spy and choose how to leverage her network.
quests.preconditions: Act II Academy hub after orientation.
raw: Overview: Expose Macha as a Fomori spy and choose how to leverage her network.
Preconditions: Act II Academy hub after orientation.
Branches
• Flip Macha (double agent)
Objectives:
– Confront with partial evidence; offer terms in private.
– Plant a false lead; test cooperation during a staged tail.
Encounters: Dialogue timing checks; reputation-gated persuasion options.; Stealth tail in courtyard and scriptorium stacks.
Variable Checks / Flags: Reputation.Outcasts +1; Carryover: C/O:Macha_Double.
Fail-forward: If tail is blown, she panics but later provides intel (reduced quality), unlocking a smaller Outcast route.
• Burn the network
Objectives:
– Intercept couriers; raid a message cache in the dorm wing.
– Publicly denounce; deliver seized intel to Hasran command.
Encounters: Timed raid with split targets; document scramble mini-game (assemble fragments).
Variable Checks / Flags: Reputation.Hasran +1; Reputation.Outcasts −1; Carryover: C/O:Macha_Burned.
Fail-forward: If documents scatter, you recover core leads; Hasran favor persists; Outcasts cool toward you.
Rejoin/Convergence: Both branches unlock different paths in Outcast Quarter and modify Recon clarity in Act III.
Rewards/Flags: XP: medium; Faction moves shape patrol heat and vendor pricing.
Systems/Notes: Later political scenes call back to this choice.

quests.title: Siege of the Spire (G12 Breach Method)
quests.overview: Defend the city and decide how to resolve the planar breach during the boss fight.
quests.preconditions: After Q15 Celeste & Q16 Airship; Act V.
raw: Overview: Defend the city and decide how to resolve the planar breach during the boss fight.
Preconditions: After Q15 Celeste & Q16 Airship; Act V.
Branches
• Stabilize with wards
Objectives:
– Power ward pylons; escort ritualists across open boulevards.
– Hold two breach surges while repairing a shattered ward circle.
Encounters: Escort-under-pressure; healer AI; pylon defense with stagger priorities.; Civilians on the field (friendly fire penalties on high difficulties).
Variable Checks / Flags: Morality +1; CatalystResonance +1; Reputation.Outcasts +1; Carryover: C/O:Breach_Stabilized.
Fail-forward: If a pylon falls, emergency circle spawns; Shard‑Tyrant gains a minor extra phase but civilians survive.
• Channel the rift
Objectives:
– Anchor the breach; overcharge a conduit to reverse the flow.
– Manage corruption spikes during Shard‑Tyrant phases (cleanse windows).
Encounters: Damage races; hazard puddles that scale with CR; corruption meter management.
Variable Checks / Flags: Morality −1; CatalystResonance +4; Reputation.Hasran +1; Carryover: C/O:Breach_Channeled.
Fail-forward: If corruption spikes too high, a purge pulse resets the phase at a health tax; boss enrages for 30s.
Rejoin/Convergence: Both branches end with Shard‑Tyrant collapse → Ritual Raid opens.
Rewards/Flags: XP: large; Title tint: ‘Savior’ lean vs ‘Void‑Touched’ lean for epilogue.
Systems/Notes: Hub state and VO change based on breach strategy.

quests.title: God‑Souled Hunt — Ritual Raid
quests.overview: The cult seeks five god‑souled to evolve the arena. Stop them with rescues or decoys.
raw: Overview: The cult seeks five god‑souled to evolve the arena. Stop them with rescues or decoys.
Preconditions: After Siege; Act VI opener.
Branches
• Protect the targets
Objectives:
– Identify five god‑souled across districts using intel routes.
– Run two parallel rescues (player swaps squads) under time pressure.
– Secure exfil via alley network and rooftop lines.
Encounters: Multi-thread rescue routing; timer-gated doors; tough choices on who to save first.
Variable Checks / Flags: Morality +1; Carryover: C/O:GodSouls_Protected.
Fail-forward: If one target falls, casualties rise and the ritual gains a buff, but the finale still proceeds; epilogue line notes the loss.
• Use decoys
Objectives:
– Craft decoy signatures with Saghir’s Weave at three workbenches.
– Bait cult hunters into layered traps; spring the arena raid.
Encounters: Ambush setups; lure mechanics; decoy durability resource to guard.
Variable Checks / Flags: CatalystResonance +2; Morality −1; Carryover: C/O:GodSouls_Decoy.
Fail-forward: If traps misfire, fallback path forces one real rescue, blending branches; tone remains darker.
Rejoin/Convergence: Converges at Conduit finale (A4).
Rewards/Flags: XP: large; Reputation deltas based on civilian casualties tracked this chapter.
Systems/Notes: Saghir’s barks reflect empathy (Protect) vs wary pragmatism (Decoys).

Variable Checks / Flags: Morality +1; Carryover: C/O:GodSouls_Protected.
Fail-forward: If one target falls, casualties rise and the ritual gains a buff, but the finale still proceeds; epilogue line notes the loss.

quests.title: Erik and the Morrigan
quests.overview: A political gambit withholds fleets, leaving Erik to face the Morrigan alone.
quests.preconditions: After Q17 Macha; before Q21 Lake Ambush; Act IV.
raw: Overview: A political gambit withholds fleets, leaving Erik to face the Morrigan alone.
Preconditions: After Q17 Macha; before Q21 Lake Ambush; Act IV.
Branches
• Intervene
Objectives:
– Traverse breach‑ridden rooftops to reach the dueling grounds.
– Disrupt the Morrigan’s opening gambit (counter her opener).
– Extract Erik under covering fire to a safe balcony.
Encounters: High-mobility platforming with gap closers; duelist miniboss windows.
Variable Checks / Flags: Morality +1; Reputation.Outcasts +1; Carryover: C/O:Erik_Saved.
Fail-forward: If extraction falters, Erik is wounded but lives; debt still owed.
• Stand aside
Objectives:
– Observe and report outcomes; ensure strategic assets remain intact.
– Optional pick-off to prevent worst civilian casualties.
Encounters: Observation stealth with vantage points; limited-intervention shots.
Variable Checks / Flags: Reputation.Hasran +2; Morality −1; Carryover: C/O:Erik_Alone.
Fail-forward: If civilians die, Outcasts −1 additional; you still retain Hasran favor.
Rejoin/Convergence: Feeds Q21 Lake Ambush tone and faction presence.
Rewards/Flags: XP: medium; changes patrol heat and vendor pricing.
Systems/Notes: Later dialogue references this decision explicitly.

quests.title: Catalyst Ambush at the Lake
quests.overview: A planned ambush around a Catalyst threatens Erik’s quint; choose tactics.
quests.preconditions: After Q20; closes Act IV loop before Siege prep.
raw: Overview: A planned ambush around a Catalyst threatens Erik’s quint; choose tactics.
Preconditions: After Q20; closes Act IV loop before Siege prep.
Branches
• Hold the line
Objectives:
– Form a defensive wedge; cover the quint’s retreat path.
– Counter a two-front push until evac arrives (timer).
Encounters: Wave defense; stagger and ward timing; environmental cover management.
Variable Checks / Flags: Morality +1; SaghirLoyalty +3; Carryover: C/O:Lake_Hold.
Fail-forward: If the line breaks, evac still extracts most; SL +2 instead of +3; minor casualty epilogue line.
• Break contact
Objectives:
– Deploy smoke; retreat through cattail trenches.
– Avoid patrol flares; regroup on hilltop and rejoin main force.
Encounters: Stealth pathing; timed flares; brief skirmishes if detected.
Variable Checks / Flags: Reputation.Hasran +1; Carryover: C/O:Lake_Break.
Fail-forward: If spotted, small skirmish triggers; regroup succeeds; lose minor materials.
Rejoin/Convergence: Converges into Temple Order if not yet completed, else moves to Siege prep state.
Rewards/Flags: XP: medium; Materials: field kits; faction perception adjusted.
Systems/Notes: Newsboards and NPC barks cite your tactics later.

quests.title: Refugee Priority
quests.overview: Decide relief strategy for the Outcast Quarter during the crisis.
quests.preconditions: During Act IV hub setup; before Siege escalation.
raw: Overview: Decide relief strategy for the Outcast Quarter during the crisis.
Preconditions: During Act IV hub setup; before Siege escalation.
Branches
• Evacuate families first
Objectives:
– Clear safe lanes; escort caravans to warded gates.
– Hold chokepoints while gates cycle.
Encounters: Escort under ranged pressure; timing gates; optional rooftop cover fire.
Variable Checks / Flags: Morality +1; Reputation.Outcasts +2; Reputation.Hasran −1; Carryover: C/O:RefugeesSafe.
Fail-forward: If one caravan is hit, Outcasts +1 only; Hasran −1 persists.
• Secure armories first
Objectives:
– Lock down weapon caches; distribute gear to militia.
– Defend two depots until locks engage.
Encounters: Short skirmishes; lock-cracking mini‑game; explosive barrels risk.
Variable Checks / Flags: Reputation.Hasran +2; Reputation.Outcasts −1; CatalystResonance +1; Carryover: C/O:ArmsSecured.
Fail-forward: If a cache is overrun, Hasran +1 only; Outcasts −1 persists.
Rejoin/Convergence: Impacts Siege spawn weights and vendor stock in the hub.
Rewards/Flags: XP: medium; unlocks vendors based on outcome.
Systems/Notes: Hub visuals swap signage and NPC chatter accordingly.

quests.title: Arena Ethos
quests.overview: Win the arena trial to secure Academy admission; define your public image.
raw: Overview: Win the arena trial to secure Academy admission; define your public image.
Preconditions: Act I Arena sequence.
Branches
• Win with restraint
Objectives:
– Parry three champion strings; avoid lethal finishers.
– Perform a non‑lethal crowd‑pleasing finisher (prompt).
Encounters: Precision parry windows; crowd heat meter learns ‘respect’ thresholds.
Variable Checks / Flags: Morality +1; CatalystResonance +2; Carryover: C/O:PrecisionBias.
Fail-forward: If you accidentally kill, branch flips to Fury; crowd boos; admission still granted.
• Win with fury
Objectives:
– Build Catalyst meter quickly; trigger overdrive to end duel.
– Use hazards to stagger champion into kill zone.
Encounters: Aggro management; overdrive burn; hazard awareness.
Variable Checks / Flags: Morality −1; CatalystResonance +5; Carryover: C/O:CorruptionBias.
Fail-forward: If you gas out, Saghir callout opens a stun window; you still win with Fury tone.
Rejoin/Convergence: Both routes lead to Academy Invite with tailored VO lines.
Rewards/Flags: XP: medium; public nickname and initial vendor prices vary.
Systems/Notes: Patrol tolerance shifts slightly based on ethos.

quests.title: Conduit Decision
quests.overview: Final choice at the ritual conduit; determines ending tint and strong CR swing.
quests.preconditions: Act VI finale after Ritual Raid ‘God‑Souled’.
raw: Overview: Final choice at the ritual conduit; determines ending tint and strong CR swing.
Preconditions: Act VI finale after Ritual Raid ‘God‑Souled’.
Branches
• Destroy the conduit
Objectives:
– Interrupt ritualist nodes; reverse flow via wardline puzzle.
– Shatter the focus before the overcharge.
Encounters: Puzzle‑lite node locks; add waves; timed interrupts.
Variable Checks / Flags: Morality +1; CatalystResonance +2; Carryover: C/O:SaviorState.
Fail-forward: If timer lapses once, backup wardline spawns; fight extends but destruction remains possible.
• Absorb the conduit
Objectives:
– Anchor yourself; channel the focus into your core.
– Survive corruption surges while maintaining control.
Encounters: Damage‑over‑time management; expanding hazard rings; reduced healing windows.
Variable Checks / Flags: Morality −1; CatalystResonance +8; Carryover: C/O:VoidTouchedState.
Fail-forward: If corruption maxes, Saghir triggers an emergency ward once; scene resumes with a scar line in epilogue.
Rejoin/Convergence: Ends Act VI → Epilogue variations (Savior vs Void‑Touched).
Rewards/Flags: XP: boss-tier; tint & VO change for credits stinger.
Systems/Notes: Save carries all flags for Game II.
